questions.question: What are the 3 Vs of Big Data?
questions.correctAnswer: Volume, Velocity, Variety

questions.question: What is Hadoop?
options: An open-source framework for distributed storage and processing of big data
questions.correctAnswer: An open-source framework for distributed storage and processing of big data

questions.question: What does HDFS stand for?
questions.correctAnswer: Hadoop Distributed File System

questions.question: What is 'MapReduce'?
options: A programming model for processing large data sets with a parallel, distributed algorithm
questions.correctAnswer: A programming model for processing large data sets with a parallel, distributed algorithm

questions.question: What is Apache Spark?
options: A unified analytics engine for large-scale data processing
questions.correctAnswer: A unified analytics engine for large-scale data processing

questions.question: What is a 'Data Lake'?
options: A centralized repository that allows you to store all your structured and unstructured data at any scale
questions.correctAnswer: A centralized repository that allows you to store all your structured and unstructured data at any scale

questions.question: What is 'ETL'?
questions.correctAnswer: Extract, Transform, Load

questions.question: What is 'NoSQL'?
questions.correctAnswer: Not Only SQL (non-relational databases)

questions.question: Which of these is a streaming platform?
questions.correctAnswer: Apache Kafka

questions.question: What is 'Hive'?
options: A data warehouse software project built on top of Hadoop
questions.correctAnswer: A data warehouse software project built on top of Hadoop

questions.question: What is functionality of 'Spark RDD'?
options: Resilient Distributed Datasets - fundamental data structure of Spark
questions.correctAnswer: Resilient Distributed Datasets - fundamental data structure of Spark

questions.question: What is the difference between Batch and Stream processing?
options: Batch processes stored data in chunks, Stream processes data in real-time as it arrives
questions.correctAnswer: Batch processes stored data in chunks, Stream processes data in real-time as it arrives

questions.question: What is 'YARN'?
options: Yet Another Resource Negotiator (Cluster resource management)
questions.correctAnswer: Yet Another Resource Negotiator (Cluster resource management)

questions.question: What is 'Cassandra' known for?
options: Wide-column store, high availability, and scalability
questions.correctAnswer: Wide-column store, high availability, and scalability

questions.question: What is 'Zookeeper' used for?
options: Centralized service for maintaining configuration information, naming, providing distributed synchronization
questions.correctAnswer: Centralized service for maintaining configuration information, naming, providing distributed synchronization

questions.question: What is 'Data Warehousing'?
options: Process of collecting and managing data from varied sources to provide meaningful business insights
questions.correctAnswer: Process of collecting and managing data from varied sources to provide meaningful business insights

questions.question: What is a 'NameNode' in HDFS?
options: Master node that manages the file system namespace and metadata
questions.correctAnswer: Master node that manages the file system namespace and metadata

questions.question: What is 'Spark Dataframe'?
options: Distributed collection of data organized into named columns
questions.correctAnswer: Distributed collection of data organized into named columns

questions.question: What is 'Lazy Evaluation' in Spark?
options: Transformations are not computed immediately, but when an action is triggered
questions.correctAnswer: Transformations are not computed immediately, but when an action is triggered

questions.question: What is 'Sharding'?
questions.correctAnswer: Distributing data across multiple machines

questions.question: What is 'HBase'?
options: A scalable, distributed database that supports structured data storage for large tables (built on HDFS)
questions.correctAnswer: A scalable, distributed database that supports structured data storage for large tables (built on HDFS)

questions.question: What is 'Pig' (Apache Pig)?
options: A high-level platform for creating MapReduce programs used with Hadoop
questions.correctAnswer: A high-level platform for creating MapReduce programs used with Hadoop

questions.question: What is 'Sqoop'?
options: A tool designed for efficiently transferring bulk data between Apache Hadoop and structured datastores
questions.correctAnswer: A tool designed for efficiently transferring bulk data between Apache Hadoop and structured datastores

questions.question: What is 'Oozie'?
options: A workflow scheduler system to manage Hadoop jobs
questions.correctAnswer: A workflow scheduler system to manage Hadoop jobs

questions.question: What is 'Flume'?
options: A distributed service for collecting, aggregating, and moving large amounts of log data
questions.correctAnswer: A distributed service for collecting, aggregating, and moving large amounts of log data

questions.question: What is the CAP Theorem?
options: Consistency, Availability, Partition Tolerance - pick two
questions.correctAnswer: Consistency, Availability, Partition Tolerance - pick two

questions.question: What is 'Broadcast Variable' in Spark?
options: A read-only variable cached on each machine rather than shipping a copy with tasks
questions.correctAnswer: A read-only variable cached on each machine rather than shipping a copy with tasks

questions.question: What is 'Accumulator' in Spark?
options: Variables that are only added to through an associative and commutative operation
questions.correctAnswer: Variables that are only added to through an associative and commutative operation

questions.question: What is 'Replication Factor' in HDFS?
options: The number of times a block is replicated (default 3)
questions.correctAnswer: The number of times a block is replicated (default 3)

questions.question: What is 'Lambda Architecture'?
options: A data-processing architecture designed to handle massive quantities of data by taking advantage of both batch and stream-processing methods
questions.correctAnswer: A data-processing architecture designed to handle massive quantities of data by taking advantage of both batch and stream-processing methods

questions.question: What is 'Kappa Architecture'?
options: An architecture that processes data in real-time, removing the batch layer
questions.correctAnswer: An architecture that processes data in real-time, removing the batch layer

questions.question: What is 'Parquet'?
questions.correctAnswer: A columnar storage file format

questions.question: What is 'Avro'?
options: A row-oriented remote procedure call and data serialization framework
questions.correctAnswer: A row-oriented remote procedure call and data serialization framework

questions.question: What is 'Dag' in Spark?
questions.correctAnswer: Directed Acyclic Graph

questions.question: What is 'Skewed Data'?
options: Data that is not evenly distributed across partitions
questions.correctAnswer: Data that is not evenly distributed across partitions

questions.question: What is 'Shuffle' operation?
questions.correctAnswer: Redistributing data across partitions (expensive)

questions.question: What is 'Bloom Filter'?
options: A probabilistic data structure to test whether an element is a member of a set
questions.correctAnswer: A probabilistic data structure to test whether an element is a member of a set

questions.question: What is 'Exactly-Once Semantics'?
options: Guaranteeing that each message is processed exactly once
questions.correctAnswer: Guaranteeing that each message is processed exactly once

questions.question: What is 'Block Size' in HDFS?
options: The size of data chunks stored (default 128MB)
questions.correctAnswer: The size of data chunks stored (default 128MB)

questions.question: What is 'Catalyst Optimizer'?
questions.correctAnswer: Spark SQL's query optimizer

questions.question: What is 'Tungsten' project?
options: Spark initiative to improve memory and CPU efficiency
questions.correctAnswer: Spark initiative to improve memory and CPU efficiency

questions.question: What is 'Secondary NameNode'?
options: It checkpoints the filesystem state (fsimage and edit logs) to prevent long startup times
questions.correctAnswer: It checkpoints the filesystem state (fsimage and edit logs) to prevent long startup times

questions.question: What is 'Speculative Execution'?
options: Running a backup task on another node if one task is running slowly
questions.correctAnswer: Running a backup task on another node if one task is running slowly

questions.question: What is 'Kerberos'?
questions.correctAnswer: A network authentication protocol

questions.question: What is 'Ranger'?
questions.correctAnswer: A framework for security/access control

questions.question: What is 'Atlas'?
questions.correctAnswer: Data governance and metadata framework

questions.question: What is 'Impala'?
options: Open source, native analytic database for Apache Hadoop
questions.correctAnswer: Open source, native analytic database for Apache Hadoop

questions.question: What is 'Phoenix'?
options: SQL skin database engine for HBase
questions.correctAnswer: SQL skin database engine for HBase

questions.question: What is 'Nifi'?
options: An easy to use, powerful, and reliable system to process and distribute data
questions.correctAnswer: An easy to use, powerful, and reliable system to process and distribute data

questions.question: What is 'Zeppelin'?
options: Web-based notebook that enables data-driven, interactive data analytics
questions.correctAnswer: Web-based notebook that enables data-driven, interactive data analytics
